intro: Reediella gracillima, commonly known as the slender reediella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. Native to wetland and marshy habitats, it thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils. The plant typically grows in dense clusters, often forming part of the vegetation in swampy areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
